dct_description_sm: Map showing territories under dispute during the Anglo Boer War, 1899-1902 and in the vicinity, including the southern part of Transvaal, the Orange Free State, Basutoland, Natal, Zululand, the Cape Colony and an eastern sliver of British Bechuanaland.
Shows rivers, roads, hills, telegraph lines, railways and railways under construction.
Bar scale on map given in "Miles."

Inset maps: Pretoria (scale 1 in. to 2 miles) -- Kimberley (scale 1 in. to 2 miles) -- Bloemfontein (scale 1 in. to 2 miles) -- Mafeking (scale 1 in. to 3 miles) -- Johannesburg (scale 1 in. to 2 miles) -- Ladysmith (scale 1 in. to 6 miles -- Dundee (scale 1 in. to 4 miles = 1 inch) -- South Africa.
"Copyright for U.S. America ceded to Major L. I Seymour for benefit of Railway Pioneer Regiment Sustentation Fund."
The map is damaged. The inset map in the lower right hand corner, depicting South Africa as a whole, has been torn away.
dct_rights_sm: Image courtesy University of Cape Town Libraries, Special Collections: Maps scanned under the William and Yvonne Jacobson Digital Africana Program at UCT. If you have questions, please contact David Rumsey Map Center at rumseymapcenter@stanford.edu.
